title: "We should give Zed mana instead of energy! That'd balance him!"
body:
I hope people realize that giving him mana costs would make him a free win after 10 minutes with how his kit works.

He'd just build CDR/tank with one or two damage items at most and then faceroll everything.

Sure he'd be a bit weaker for the first few minutes but this would legit make him more broken than you guys can fathom if you still think he's OP right now.

No, he most definitely is not resource-less...

Why is it people fail to recognize that energy gating exists?

Energy prevails for extended laning phase because you essentially never run out unless you spam, but your energy pool is too low to sustain skill-spamming in teamfights.

Mana prevails for skirmishes,  and teamfights because you have a large enough resource pool to last through the fight, but your regen is too low and thus sucks at extended laning.

No, he gets it for the energy regen.

Have you played Zed? 

Or Akali?

Or Kennen?

Or.... anyone with energy?

I think the difference the original poster was discussing is that you can run out of energy much faster than mana given the small pool. If you have ever played zed you can definitely spam stuff fast enough to run out of energy (especially if you miss refunds, zed's mechanics are tough enough there is a reason why he legit just shouldn't be played sub plat or at least sub high gold) and the moments where a zed player is out of energy and can't cast right away will be gone if he became mana gated. They go away because with something like fh he not only gets cdr, but also more continuous casts in a small amount of time. Mana gating would hurt zed's ability to poke with shuriken but would increase his ability to spam spells in team fights and ensure he was almost never out of energy to cast a shadow if it was off cool down. In bronze and silver it might not matter as much because people in those elo brackets can't play zed well, but any good zed does NOT need more mobility.

Maybe he can't keep up with his cd when played perfect in which case I definitely think nerfs would be in order, but I still think changing the energy costs would work better than mana. 

It throws back to the issues in his design though. Like I was trying to say, zed is a high elo issue bc riot won't just ban him below plat elo. His kit makes him so much stronger in a good players hand than a weak player's hand that to balance him for high elo would make him pre rework eve level for bronze and silver and riot won't do that so zed stays an issue.

OP is pretty damn correct actually. Energy gating is a real thing, people. I'd rather have Zed have an easier time in lane than have him bounce around with no energy limitations in teamfights later on.

Think of URF. Zed is oppressive as all fuck on that game mode, not only because 80% cdr was the thing but because he actually couldn't run out of resources mid teamfight, meaning he could spam all his skills on CD.

Apply this to a Zed with mana in a regular game. 40% cdr (FH, lucidity, 5% mastery or whatever combination you want) and a large enough mana pool to go through an entire teamfight without running out of mana thanks to FH. As far as skirmishes/teamfights/objective control goes, this Zed is only 40% cdr below his URF counterpart.

After looking at the responses:

We should really differentiate Energy as a resource from being resourceless...

Zed isn't going to always hit mimicked spells and it's actually your burden (as terrible as it is) to prevent him from landing mimicked spells.
